words.translation: Woe|to those who give less

translations.15: Woe to the defrauders

words.translation: Those who|when|they take a measure|from|the people|they take in full

translations.15: Those who take full measure ˹when they buy˺ from people

words.translation: But when|they give by measure (to) them|or|they weigh (for) them|they give less

translations.15: but give less when they measure or weigh for buyers

words.translation: Do not|think|those|that they|(will be) resurrected

translations.15: Do such people not think that they will be resurrected

words.translation: For a Day|Great

translations.15: for a tremendous Day—

words.translation: (The) Day|will stand|mankind|before (the) Lord|(of) the worlds

translations.15: the Day ˹all˺ people will stand before the Lord of all worlds

words.translation: Nay!|Indeed|(the) record|(of) the wicked|(is) surely in|Sijjin

translations.1: Kallaaa inna kitaabal fujjaari lafee Sijjeen
translations.15: But no! The wicked are certainly bound for Sijjîn ˹in the depths of Hell˺—

words.translation: And what|can make you know|what|(is) Sijjin

translations.15: and what will make you realize what Sijjîn is?—

words.translation: A book|written

translations.15: a fate ˹already˺ sealed

words.translation: Woe|that Day|to the deniers

translations.15: Woe on that Day to the deniers—

words.translation: Those who|deny|(the) Day|(of) the Judgment

translations.15: those who deny Judgment Day

words.translation: And not|can deny|[of] it|except|every|transgressor|sinful

translations.1: Wa-maa yukazzibu biheee illaa kullu mu'tadin aseem
translations.15: None would deny it except every evildoing transgressor

words.translation: When|are recited|to him|Our Verses|he says|Stories|(of) the former (people)

translations.1: Izaa tutlaa 'alaihi aayaatunaa qaala asaateerul awwaleen
translations.15: Whenever Our revelations are recited to them, they say, “Ancient fables!”

words.translation: Nay!|But|(the) stain has covered|[over]|their hearts|(for) what|they were|earning

translations.1: Kallaa bal raana 'alaa quloobihim maa kaanoo yaksiboon
translations.15: But no! In fact, their hearts have been stained by all ˹the evil˺ they used to commit

words.translation: Nay!|Indeed they|from|their Lord|that Day|surely will be partitioned

translations.15: Undoubtedly, they will be sealed off from their Lord on that Day

words.translation: Then|indeed they|(surely) will burn|(in) the Hellfire

translations.15: Moreover, they will surely burn in Hell

words.translation: Then|it will be said|This|(is) what|you used (to)|[of it]|deny

translations.1: Summa yuqaalu haazal lazee kuntum bihee tukazziboon
translations.15: and then be told, “This is what you used to deny.”

words.translation: Nay!|Indeed|(the) record|(of) the righteous|(will be) surely in|Illiyin

translations.1: Kallaaa inna kitaabal abraari lafee'il liyyeen
translations.15: But no! The virtuous are certainly bound for ’Illiyûn ˹in elevated Gardens˺—

words.translation: And what|can make you know|what|(is) Illiyun

translations.15: and what will make you realize what ’Illiyûn is?—

words.translation: A book|written

translations.15: a fate ˹already˺ sealed

words.translation: Witness it|those brought near

translations.15: witnessed by those nearest ˹to Allah˺

words.translation: Indeed|the righteous|(will be) surely in|bliss

translations.15: Surely the virtuous will be in bliss

words.translation: On|thrones|observing

translations.15: ˹seated˺ on ˹canopied˺ couches, gazing around

words.translation: You will recognize|in|their faces|(the) radiance|(of) bliss

translations.15: You will recognize on their faces the glow of delight

words.translation: They will be given to drink|of|a pure wine|sealed

translations.15: They will be given a drink of sealed, pure wine

words.translation: Its seal|(will be of) musk|And for|that|let aspire|the aspirers

translations.1: Khitaamuhoo misk; Wa-fee zaalika falyatanaafasil Mutanaafisoon
translations.15: whose last sip will smell like musk. So let whoever aspires to this strive ˹diligently˺

words.translation: And its mixture|(is) of|Tasnim

translations.15: And this drink’s flavour will come from Tasnîm—

words.translation: A spring|will drink|from it|those brought near

translations.15: a spring from which those nearest ˹to Allah˺ will drink

words.translation: Indeed|those who|committed crimes|used (to)|at|those who|believed|laugh

translations.1: Innal lazeena ajramoo kaanoo minal lazeena aamanoo yadhakoon
translations.15: Indeed, the wicked used to laugh at the believers

words.translation: And when|they passed|by them|they winked at one another

translations.15: wink to one another whenever they passed by

words.translation: And when|they returned|to|their people|they would return|jesting

translations.1: Wa-izan qalabooo ilaaa ahlihimun qalaboo fakiheen
translations.15: and muse ˹over these exploits˺ upon returning to their own people

words.translation: And when|they saw them|they said|Indeed|these|surely have gone astray

translations.1: Wa-izaa ra-awhum qaalooo inna haaa'ulaaa'i ladaaal-loon
translations.15: And when they saw the faithful, they would say, “These ˹people˺ are truly astray,”

words.translation: But not|they had been sent|over them|(as) guardians

translations.15: even though they were not sent as keepers over the believers

words.translation: So today|those who|believed|at|the disbelievers|they will laugh

translations.1: Fal-yawmal lazeena aamanoo minal kuffaari yadhakoon
translations.15: But on that Day the believers will be laughing at the disbelievers

words.translation: On|the thrones|observing

translations.15: as they sit on ˹canopied˺ couches, looking on

words.translation: Have (not)|been paid|the disbelievers|(for) what|they used (to)|do

translations.1: Hal suwwibal kuffaaru maa kaanoo yaf'aloon
translations.15: ˹The believers will be asked,˺ “Have the disbelievers ˹not˺ been paid back for what they used to do?”
